intro: Ligusticum involucratum, commonly known as the clustered lovage, is a perennial herb native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic, compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its roots and leaves are often used in traditional herbal medicine for their purported digestive and anti-inflammatory properties. Ligusticum involucratum thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas.
